verses.verse: "Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be compared to ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
"Five of them were wise and five foolish.
"Those who were foolish took their lamps but took no oil with them.
"But the wise took oil in their containers along with their lamps.
"While the bridegroom lingered, they all fell asleep and slept.
"At midnight there was a shout given, «Look! The bridegroom comes; go out to meet him.»
"Then all those virgins got up and trimmed their lamps.
"But the foolish said to the wise, «Give us some of your oil, for our lamps have gone out.»
"But the wise answered, saying, «No, lest there won't be enough for us and you. Instead you go to those who sell and buy for yourselves.»
"While they went to buy, the bridegroom came. Those who were ready went in with him to the marriage, and the door was shut.
"Later the other virgins also came saying, «Lord, Lord open to us.»
"But he answered and said, «Truly I say to you; I do not know you.»
"So then, be watching, for you don't know neither the day or the hour in which the Son of Man comes.
"For [the Kingdom of Heaven is] like a man traveling into a far away country, who summoned his servants and gave them his possessions.
"And he gave five talents to one, two to another, one to another. Everyone [was given] according to his ability, then he immediately took his journey.
"Then he who had received five talents went and traded with it and made five talents more.
"In the same way he who [had received] two also made two more.
"But he who had received one went and dug in the dirt and hid his lord's money.
"After a long time the lord of those servants came and wanted an account from them.
"So he who had received five talents came and brought five more talents saying, «Lord, You give me five talents. Look! I have gained five more talents.»
"His lord said to him, «Well done good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a little; I will make you ruler over much. Enter into the joy of your lord.»
"He who had received two talents came and said, «Lord, you gave me two talents. Look! I have gained two more talents.»
"His lord said to him, «Well done good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a little; I will make you ruler over much. Enter into the joy of you lord.»
"Then he who had received the one talent came and said, «Lord, I know you. You are a hard man reaping where you haven't sown and gathering where you haven't dispersed.
«And I was afraid, went, and hid your talent in the dirt. Look, have what's yours.»
"His lord answered and said to him, «You wicked, slothful servant. You knew that I reap where I didn't sow and gather where I haven't dispersed.»
"Therefore you should have put my money with the bankers, and when I came, I could have received my own with interest.
"Therefore take the talent from him and give it to him who has ten talents.
"For to everyone who has something, more will be given, and he will have much, but from him who has nothing, even what he has will be taken away.
"Throw the undeserving servant into outer darkness. Weeping and gnashing of teeth will be there.
"When the Son of Man will come in his glory and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.
"All nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate them from one another like a shepherd divides his sheep from the goats.
"He will set the sheep on his right hand and the goats on the left.
"Then the King will say to them on his right hand, «Come blessed of my Father; inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.
«For I was hungry, and you gave me food. I was thirsty, and you gave me something to drink. I was a stranger, and you took me in.
"'[I was] naked, and you clothed me. I was sick, and you visited me. I was in prison, and you came to me.'
"Then the righteous will answer him, saying, «Lord, when did we see you hungry and fed you, or thirsty and gave you something to drink?
«When did we see you a stranger and took you in, or naked and clothed you?
«Or when did we see you sick or in prison and came to you?»
"Then the King will answer and say to them, «Truly I say to you, inasmuch as you have done it to one of the least of these my brethren, you have done it to me.»
"Then he will say to those on his left hand, «Get away from me, you cursed, into everlasting fire prepared for the devil and his angels.
«For I was hungry, and you gave me no food. I was thirsty, and you gave me nothing to drink.
«I was a stranger, and you didn't take me in; naked, and you didn't clothe me; sick and in prison, and you didn't visit me.»
"Then they will also answer him, saying, «Lord, when did we see you hungry, thirsty, a stranger, naked, sick, or in prison, and didn't help you?»
"Then he will answer them, saying, «Truly, I say to you, inasmuch as you did not do it for one of the least of these, you didn't do it for me.»
"These will go away into everlasting punishment but the righteous into eternal life."
